ja6:1.1: The story tells of how two brothers are asked by a spirit what are “godly qualities”. Their replies—“the sun and moon” and the “four directions”—win them only death. The third broither replies correctly.
ja6:1.4: _Devadhamma_ appears at [ja458:7.3]() where it means “god’s ways”. _Devadhammika_ is a religious order at [an5:302:1.1](), [tha-ap411:11.2]().
